body_html:
I reviewed the code and finally found I was wrong. I am sorry for that. The keras implementation is good. 👍
ps: maybe use default axis = -1 is better? Many keras users prefer directly writing "x = InstanceNormalization()(x);" when the last layer is a channel-last conv2d. In this case, it will take them many time to finally found out that they should add "axis=3".
I know that the default axis=None is prepared for dense layer. But the original keras prefers the -1 implementation, right?

body:
I reviewed the code and finally found I was wrong. I am sorry for that. The keras implementation is good. 👍 
ps: maybe use default axis = -1 is better? Many keras users prefer directly writing "x = InstanceNormalization()(x);" when the last layer is a channel-last conv2d. In this case, it will take them many time to finally found out that they should add "axis=3".
I know that the default axis=None is prepared for dense layer. But the original keras prefers the -1 implementation, right?
